content: sassy cat hat by crochetcopia https //youtu be/ft7gny3x9fw si=ggvitl9fpsuyll4i pattern written by richard craven with the help of the loops and chains crochet group of cheney wa extra thank you to jacye g anything written in itialics are additional hints and tricks that we thought would be helpful but are not apart of the original video pattern produced by crochetcopia yarn any size yarn can be used a medium weight 4 was used in video two or more colors while you can do a minimum of 2 contrasting colors i would recommend a minimum of 3 colors to better see the cat tails when the hat is finished all colors of yarn should be of the same weight and type of yarn hook 4 5mm hook used in video you can also use the hook size recommended for the size yarn being used notes this pattern is written in american crochet terms pattern is in multiples of 4 change color every 2 row after foundation row the row after the row with the ldc pattern is the larks foot turned upside down attach the new color of yarn to the last of the 3 double_crochet group either before or after the last slip_stitch stagger the attachment spots but keep them in roughly the same area this will be the back of the hat pattern per the video uses a chain 3 as the start of a row to equal the height of a double_crochet and does count as a stitch you can use the chain 3 a chain 2 or a stacked single_crochet as your starting stitch whatever you are comfortable with and used to i prefer to use the stacked single for projects like this each new color set will be offset from the previous color row the ch1 skst will be over the center double_crochet of the 3 double_crochet group the 2nd row of each set will be directly over the stitches above the 1st row for example double_crochet in the double_crochet ch1 sk1 above the previous row ch1 sk1 if you are only using 2 or 3 colors carry the yarn up the inside of the hat instead of cutting the yarn abbreviations yo yarn over 1 chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet ldc long double_crochet fdhdc half double foundation chain round round skip skip a stitch fpdc front post double_crochet bpdc back post double_crochet rsc reverse single_crochet stitch aka crab stitch special stitches fhdc foundation half_double_crochet stitch chain 3 yo insert hook into 1st chain yo draw through 1st loop yo draw through 1 creates the foundation chain yo draw through all 3 loops creates the half_double_crochet yo insert hook through 2 loops at the bottom yo draw through 1st loop yo draw through all 3 loops the loops you insert your hook through will be at the bottom of the just completed set ldc long double_crochet yo insert hook into skipped stitch 3 row down 1 row down if doing final row encapsulating
